newsitem.title: CYPRUS: Cyprus agency cuts ratings for S.Korean banks.
newsitem.headline: Cyprus agency cuts ratings for S.Korean banks.

text.p: Cyprus-based bank rating agency Capital Intelligence said it had changed its outlook for certain major Korean banks to negative from stable.

The banks affected are Commercial Bank of Korea Ltd, Donghwa Bank, Hanil Bank Ltd, Industrial Bank of Korea, Koram Bank Ltd, Korea Development Bank, Korea Long Term Development Bank and Shinhan Bank Ltd.
Capital Intelligence said Commercial Bank of Korea is exposed to failed Sammi Steel Co.

The agency said in a statement it was "assigning negative outlooks to the other banks to reflect the relative slowdown of the country's economy, the excessive gearing of many companies and the higher incidence of corporate failure, which may well be exacerbated by the otherwise welcome tightening of banks' credit approval procedures in the wake of recent high profile defaults."
